item.title: Git Tips - Using multiple SSH keys with Git | Git in-use
item.description: Using Multiple SSH Keys for GitWhen you work with Git, you might need to use different SSH keys for different repositories. For example, you might have personal and work Git accounts, each with their own SSH keys. In this case, you need to tell Git which key to use for which repository. One way to do this is to use SSH configuration files. These files allow you to specify the SSH key and other options to use when connecting to a specific host.

item.title: Git Alias - The shorthand power | Git in-use
item.description: Different from alias bound to the bash-liked shell of the system. Git aliases are more like a shorter command to be typed command started with git <alias>. Aliases also have the scope limited to local project or global configuration. The configurations would be stored at .gitconfig.
